title: Ticket #7629: figure out how to conclusively determine which credd we should use
description:
For storing and querying credentials such as Kerberos and OAuth, we assume that there is a CredD colocated with the SchedD we will be using to submit jobs.

Knowing how to contact the CredD is straightforward if we are talking to a local SchedD and CredD. However, it's less clear what it means to contact "The CredD" when daemons are remote.

For Krb/OAuth, there is probably one CredD associated with each SchedD. Do they need to have the same name? Does the SchedD advertise its associated CredD? How would a condor_submit client know who to store creds with to do a remote submit. Etc.

However, in non-Krb/OAuth cases, we might have one CredD for the whole pool. How is this communicated to condor_submit? How is it specified in the config file?

This ticket is a broad umbrella to list different modes of operation we support, what assumptions are making for each, and proposals for making this easy for admins to configure.
